## Description {#details}

Tracks DebugLocs between checkpoints and verifies that they are transferred.

<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Call this to indicate that it&#39;s a good point to assess whether locations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// have been lost. Typically this will be when a logical change has been</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// completed such as the caller has finished replacing some instructions with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// alternatives. When CheckDebugLocs is true, the locations will be checked</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to see if any have been lost since the last checkpoint. When</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CheckDebugLocs is false, it will just reset ready for the next checkpoint</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// without checking anything. This can be helpful to limit the detection to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// easy-to-fix portions of an algorithm before allowing more difficult ones.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/lostdebuglocobserver/#a91c878e342c004f480a55e8dc3f6fa67">checkpoint</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CheckDebugLocs = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
